Description: Bone doll; carved from animal-bone; head with a dowel at the base of the neck; flat top; pigmented recessed eyes and eyebrows; several traces of green pigment on the brow.
Curator's comments: Originally registered as ivory and described as a pin head.

On dolls of this type: A. Shatil, "Bone Figurines of the Early Islamic Period: The So Called 'Coptic Dolls' from Palestine and Egypt", in: S. Vitezović, ed. Close to the Bone: Current Studies in Bone Technologies (Belgrade 2016) 296-314.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
